document_data.title: Dragon Annual 1
document_data.edition1: <!-- leave blank if there is only one -->
document_data.mainbody: '''''Dragon Annual 1''''' was published by [[TSR, Inc.]] in December of 1996.  It contained the following articles related to the [[Forgotten Realms]]:
document_data.[[Ecology]] of the Wyvern:
: ''By [[Spike Y. Jones]], Illustrated by [[Scott Rosema]].'' '''p. 8-12'''
A scholarly treatise on the [[Wyvern]]. {{Drasup|1/Ecology of the Wyvern}}
document_data.[[Arcane Lore]]: Scrolls of the Ice Mage:
: ''By [[Anne W. Davis]], Illustrated by [[Storn Cook]].'' '''p. 26-30'''
Frosty new spells for all wizards. {{Drasup|1996/Arcane Lore: Scrolls of the Ice Mage}}
document_data.[[The Dragon's Bestiary]]: Predators of:
: ''By [[Keith Strohm]], Illustrated by [[James Holloway]].'' '''p. 35â€“43'''
The reason you should be afraid of the dark. {{Drasup|1996/The Dragon's Bestiary: Predators of the Underdark}}

* [[Chromatic mold]]
* [[Elghonn]]
* [[Gohlbrorn]]
* [[Lukhorn]]
* [[Varkha]]
document_data.[[Rogues Gallery]]: In Silver Shadows:
: ''By [[Elaine Cunningham]].'' '''p. 41-43'''
From the pages of ''[[Silver Shadows]]'' come three new heroes. {{Drasup|1996/Rogues Gallery: In Silver Shadows}}

* [[Allain Kevanarial]]
* [[Ferret (thief)|Ferret]]
* [[Hasheth Balik]]
document_data.[[Campaign Classics]]: The Scro:
: ''By [[Roger E. Moore]], Illustrated by [[Mark Nelson]].'' '''p. 44-52'''
The Chosen of Dukagsh are poised to invade worlds in any crystal sphere. A Spelljammer Monster for Groundling Campaigns. {{Drasup|1996/Campaign Classics: The Scro}}
document_data.Forgotten Realms introduction:
: ''By [[Ed Greenwood]].'' '''p. 53'''
The new kingdom of the north deserves a grand palace.
document_data.Gem of the North: The high palace of [[A:
: ''By [[Steven Schend]], Illustrated by [[Lorelle Ahlstrom]].'' '''p. 54-60'''
The new kingdom of the north deserves a grand palace.{{Drasup|1/Gem of the North}}
document_data.Deckbuilding Revisited:
: ''By [[Jim Butler]].'' '''p. 109-112'''
Tuning your [[Spellfire: Master the Magic|Spellfire]] deck for competition or just for fun. {{Drasup|1996/Deckbuilding Revisited}}
